block.p: Rica Fay Rodman, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Norton Rodman of Northridge, Calif., was married last evening to Jonathan Marc Orszag, a son of Dr. and Mrs. Steven A. Orszag of Princeton, N.J. Rabbi Michael Perelmuter officiated at the Bel-Air Bay Club in Pacific Palisades, Calif.

Mr. and Mrs. Orszag work in Los Angeles, where she is the director of the Lear Family Foundation, which supports organizations that work to protect civil liberties, and he is the managing director of Sebago Associates, an economic policy consulting firm. They met in the White House, where the bride was the radio director in the office of the press secretary from 1993 to 1997 and the bridegroom was an economic policy adviser to the National Economic Council from 1995 to 1999.

Rica Fay Rodman, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Norton Rodman of Northridge, Calif., was married last evening to Jonathan Marc Orszag, a son of Dr. and Mrs. Steven A. Orszag of Princeton, N.J. Rabbi Michael Perelmuter officiated at the Bel-Air Bay Club in Pacific Palisades, Calif.

Mr. and Mrs. Orszag work in Los Angeles, where she is the director of the Lear Family Foundation, which supports organizations that work to protect civil liberties, and he is the managing director of Sebago Associates, an economic policy consulting firm. They met in the White House, where the bride was the radio director in the office of the press secretary from 1993 to 1997 and the bridegroom was an economic policy adviser to the National Economic Council from 1995 to 1999.

The bride, 29, graduated magna cum laude from the University of California at Los Angeles. Her father, a retired laboratory scientist, worked in the space and communications group of Hughes Aircraft in El Segundo, Calif. Her mother, Ellen Rodman, is a docent at the J. Paul Getty Museum in Los Angeles.

The bridegroom, 27, graduated summa cum laude from Princeton University and received a master's degree in economics and social history from Oxford University, where he was a Marshall scholar. His mother, Reba K. Orszag, is the president of Cambridge Hydrodynamics, a research and consulting firm in Princeton. His father is a professor of mathematics at Yale University in New Haven and an emeritus professor of engineering at Princeton.
